userreviews.userReview: This short read was a delightfully snarky crossover blending the Masters Admiralty series (I haven’t read it..yet) and Lexi Blake’s Masters and Mercenaries series (which I’m hooked on). Eric has come to London to hire McKay/Taggart/Knight Security for a secret job. Ian is his sarcastically witty self and Penny and Damon are still happily married. Based on this little intro, I am curious about Eric Ericsson and his colorful background with Ian. I may be checking out Carr/Dubios’s series.

As an introduction to both the Masters & Mercenaries series by Lexi Blake, and the Masters' Admiralty series by Lila Dubois and Marie Carr, this is enough to tempt anyone!!Fine: I'm up to date (almost!) with the M & M series, so looks like I have to buy into the MA one :) ::Phew:: Menage galore to look forward to!! A freebie - with thanks :)
set me up and let her rip!

description: A Masters' Admiralty / Masters and Mercenaries Crossover Story.When Europe's most powerful secret society needs covert information on their American counterparts there's only one company good enough to handle the job...Note: Published in Lexi Blake, Mari Carr, and Lila Dubois' newsletters in February 2018.
title:
Worlds Collide
      
          (Masters' Admiralty #1.5)
